item.title: Erosion of brook bank - could it be affecting the bridge, 23rd July
item.description:
/// saves.energy.spend Brook banks eroding - heavy rain causes surges in water. Residents have flagged what they think are gaps appearing in ground around the bridge.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Conway Drive, Cheltenham

item.title: Filthy outside area & side entrance, 23rd July
item.description:

item.title: Pathway VERY overgrown with trees and thorns., 23rd July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury

item.title: The area's tree canopies have significantly expanded, with many lower limbs hanging at head height (the other side of the road, has recently had the tree canopies lifted), requiring pedestrians to duck to pass through unobstructed. This overgrowth not only limits visibility for pedestrians but also encroaches into the fronting gardens of nearby properties. The five tree canopies pose a particular problem as they obstruct visibility for pedestrians crossing the street, especially on the corner, and for drivers navigating along Lobley's Drive; as the lower limbs obscure important road signage, such as the 'NO HGV' sign for Lobley's Drive Bridge., 23rd July
item.description:
Five tree's on the grass verge alongside the following properties - 47 - 61 Hazel Way, Lobley's Drive, Brockworth, GL3 4GL.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lobleys Drive, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This is not yet a hole, it does look like a sink hole is forming. It is bigger than it looks in the photo and there looks to be a second one forming next to it, area may require preventative maintenance before a sinkhole develops, 23rd July
